context: The word 'unustasid' is the second person plural past tense form of the Estonian verb 'unustama', which means 'to forget'. It specifically refers to a group of people (you all) who forgot something in the past. The root verb 'unustama' can be conjugated for different persons and tenses: unustan (I forget), unustad (you singular forget), unustas (he/she/it forgot), etc.
